books.title: The Mystery of the Yellow Room
books.author: Gaston Leroux
books.summary: A young reporter struggles to investigate a seemingly impossible crime, in which an assailant has escaped from a locked bedroom completely unseen.

books.title: Waverley
books.author: Walter Scott
books.summary: A young English officer becomes involved in the Jacobite rebellion.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Anne of Green Gables
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A coming-of-age story of a young girl growing up on a farm on Prince Edward Island.

books.title: A Gentleman of Leisure
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Jimmy Pitt gets much more than he bargained for when he bets his friends at the Strollers’ Club that he can successfully burgle a house.

books.title: Man and Superman
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Jack Tanner flees both London and responsibility when he is made guardian of his childhood friend Ann Whitehead.

books.title: The Blazing World
books.author: Margaret Cavendish
books.summary: A young lady is abducted and finds herself the empress of a strange new world.

books.title: The Return of the Native
books.author: Thomas Hardy
books.summary: A young woman longs to find a husband who can deliver her from her unexciting rural life.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: The Hashish Eater
books.author: Fitz Hugh Ludlow
books.summary: A philosophical contemplation of youthful adventures spent ingesting large doses of psychoactive cannabis extract.

books.title: The Man in the Queue
books.author: Josephine Tey
books.summary: A police inspector is baffled by the case of a man who was stabbed while waiting in a theater queue.

books.title: Democracy and Social Ethics
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams argues that addressing social issues like poverty and inequality requires shifting from individual morality to a collective understanding of social responsibility.

books.title: Walden
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: Thoreau’s report on his social experiment of solitude, simplicity, and self-reliance.

books.title: Nonsense Books
books.author: Edward Lear
books.summary: A collection of literary nonsense in the forms of limericks, songs, and short stories.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Algis Budrys
books.summary: Science fiction short stories by author Algis Budrys.

books.title: Poirot Investigates
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A calculating Belgian detective and his wide-eyed companion investigate and solve a series of mysteries.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.
